p.a: Division of Career and Technical Education Programs

div.data-code: Evadale ISD

div.p: Welcome to Evadale ISD website and thank you for your interest. We are a small 2A school located between Buna and Silsbee off of Highway 105. We have 458 students in Pre-K-12th Grade. We are very proud of our tradition in all areas of our school. From our sports competition to our academics we work hard to be the best we can be. We offer a well-rounded program here at Evadale. We have a great community that supports our school well.

Thank you everyone that participated in the first exploratory survey into the consideration of a 4 day instruction week. The feedback received is invaluable and has allowed us to move further into the process of answering all concerns and questions. The following page will serve as a portal into the process moving forward and contains many answers and ways the community can continue to provide feedback.

h3.div: Deadline to order the 2019-2020 yearbook is April 30th

div.p: To order the yearbook go to balfour.com. Click on Shop My School > type in Evadale > Select your school > Click on yearbook and Ads > enter your info; then it will allow you to purchase a yearbook!

With the announcement made today by Governor Abbott we will not be returning to school this year. We will continue to operate as we are with food, online lessons, and packets until May the 22nd. We will still have the packet pickup and food distribution on April 21st at the scheduled times. We will have a schedule Tuesday for the remainder of the year.We will be back in contact with everyone on the topic of graduation and are working on ways to honor the seniors. Thank you for everything you are doing and stay safe.
This is just a reminder to those seniors that there are many scholarship opportunities available on our scholarships page. Please read through those opportunities here. Scholarships

h3.div: Community Engagement Survey for Calendar Feedback

div.p: In an effort to gather information concerning the calendar for next school year, we ask the our parents please complete a short survey on the support and/or potential concerns in a 4 day school week. We value our communities feedback and look forward to all the responses.
4 Day School Week Survey

Wanted to let everyone know that we have available WiFi access in our parking lot running parallel to the railroad tracks. This is available for anyone to use and does not require a password to connect to. For those concerned with the security aspect of it, it is completely isolated from our network, and all guest connections are isolated from each other. Everyone gets their own connection to the internet and to nothing else. This is also filtered minimally to try and limit the false positives that would be blocked, but also prevent abuse and access to not so good things. The signal is strong enough for it to be used in your vehicle, so there is no need to congregate near the entrances.

The network name is "EISD Public WiFi" and once connected your device will prompt you to agree to the terms and conditions. The terms just say that you will not do anything illegal and we reserve the right to block devices that are using it appropriately.
If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to contact cfikes@evadalek12.net.

To order pictures email support@traditionsportraits.com requesting your student's unique code. Once they receive that email, they will respond with with the code and instructions on how to access their students photos.
Traditions Portraits has any pictures that were ordered prior to campus closure are safe in their office and will be distributed once we resume normal schedule.
April 7, 2020
Good Evening,

This is Superintendent, Gary Fairchild, of Evadale ISD. I wanted to give everyone an update on all school related activities. We will have a drop off for Jr. High and Elementary students on Thursday, April 9, 2020 from 3-6PM at the horse-shoe shaped drive at the elementary. There will be CONTINUE READING . . .
Good Afternoon,

Due to the Governor’s announcement yesterday, we will not return to school until at least May 4. This is a change from the information given to you earlier this week about EISD. I will continue to pass along information, as it becomes available. Stay home, stay safe, and may God bless you and your family.
Superintendent of Evadale ISD
Senior Scholarship Reminder:
1. Jasper County Go Texan - Due date April 9, Application documents should be mailed
2. Evadale Volunteer Fire Dept - Due April 30, Application documents should be mailed
3. Logan Hare Memorial Scholarship - Due date May 1, Application should be mailed
4. Texas Farm Bureau - Due date May 1, Access application online at http://texasfarmbureau.org.youth/youth-opportunities/
5. Triple Impact Competitor Scholarship for HS Athletes - Due May 31, Access application online at positivecoach.org/scholarships
6. ABC Scholarship - Due date has been extended to July, application documents should be mailed

In order to comply with the judicial decree put into effect for Jasper County on MArch 16th, 2020, and the amended decree put into effect; Evadale ISD will extend the suspension of classes and continue remote, home based learning through Friday April 10th 2020. CONTINUE READING . . .

Students who took the SAT at school can now view your SAT score reports by logging in to the K–12 score reporting portal at the link below. Please note: Most Essay scores will be available for students who took the SAT School Day with Essay between March 30 and April 1.

This is a reminder to students that dual credit LSCO classes will resume Monday March 30th. LSCO has also made available tutoring online at https://lsco.upswing.io/ for those needing assistance. Students wanting to register for summer classes need to email our counselor Mrs. Haden at ahaden@evadalek12.net, the deadline for registration is April 1st.

Tuesday’s and Wednesday’s starting March 24th, 2020 we will be serving students breakfast from 7-8AM and lunch from 9:30-11:30 AM. If you need assistance other than the times and dates listed, please call (409) 449-3092 and speak directly with the Cafeteria Director Pam Cox about your specific needs.
Thank you
Pam Cox

Parents, beginning March 24th EISD will begin a rotating staff schedule facilitating teacher communication and packet distribution. On Tuesdays from the hours of 12 PM and 2 PM High school and Elementary packets will be made available for pickup at the circle drive in front of the Elementary offices. Wednesdays Junior High packets will be available at the same location. If you are a parent with multiple children in multiple grade levels, you are welcome to pick up all packets on the latter of the 2 days. If you are a parent printing assignments via the online material and want to submit your packets electronically, you may do so via the teachers email address. This is an ever changing situation and any changes to this plan will be immediately communicated. Thank you for working with us through this confusing and difficult time.
Study packets will be available at the following link. Study Packets

Starting the week of march 23rd meals will be available tuesday and wednesday. Breakfast will be served from 7AM - 8AM, Lunch will be available 10AM and 12PM. If you need meal assistance on other days please contact Food Service Director Pam cox at (409) 449-3092.
Due to the current situation, prom has been delayed. More information on exact dates will be determined at a later date.

After meeting with the county judges and an abundance of caution, Evadale ISD is closing school facilities effective March 17th, 2020 to aid in preventing the spread of COVID 19. The district will reevaluate the situation April 3rd 2020.
Starting Monday March 23rd Evadale will be moving to a flexible education program.
What this means is instruction materials have been posted online for download and for those without internet access a paper assignment will be made available for pickup.
Students are not to report to school until further notice.

Those 18 and under can come up to the school between the hours of 9 and 11 AM to pick up lunch and breakfast for the next morning. This is at no cost. Pickup will take place in the junior high car pickup location. For more information please contact our Food service Director Pam Cox at 409-449-3092.
The health and safety of our staff and students is of the highest priority. Please watch the district website and the official facebook page for up to date information.
Students are not to report to school Tuesday March 17th. More details concerning schedules for the rest of the weekend long term plans will be sent out soon. Plans are still being finalized.
Again, Students are not to report to school tomorrow, but more information is coming soon.
This is a reminder that tomorrow March 15th is a teachers staff day. Students are not to report to school tomorrow.

As of this time Evadale ISD is planning on continuing school as normal, but will monitoring the situation and inform everyone of updates as they come. In an effort to gather more information needed to better solidify planning in the event of changes to that schedule, a brief two question survey is attached to this post. Please if you are sending a child to Evadale ISD complete the survey.

An outbreak of the coronavirus, first identified in China, has caused an outbreak of respiratory illness and the US has confirmed a handful of coronavirus cases that have been linked to traveling. I want to assure you that our school district is keeping track of this situation through proven and trustworthy sources: the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS), and the Centers for Disease Control and . . . Read More
908 FM 105 | Evadale, TX 77615
P O Box 497 | Evadale, TX 77615
Business Hours: Monday-Friday | 8:00 am.- 4:30pm.
